details.title: Multiple-element crosseye
details.abstract: An extension to the traditional two-element array crosseye interferometric electronic jamming technique is investigated. Simulations are performed to obtain excitations for multiple-emitter linear arrays that produce distorted wavefronts over desired regions of space. This results in a greater number of degrees-of-freedom and a better ability to control the desired field pattern. The crosseye effect can be achieved over wider sectors, but only by increasing array power. The technique is extended to two-dimensional arrays and is applicable to multi-function radar antennas. Experimental measurements performed on a four-emitter array demonstrate the feasibility of the technique. Good agreement with predictions is shown

ieee.title: Cross-eye jamming of monopulse radar
ieee.displayText: Lars Falk, "Cross-eye jamming of monopulse radar", Waveform Diversity and Design Conference 2007. International, pp. 209-213, 2007.

ieee.title: Extended Analysis of Retrodirective Cross-Eye Jamming

ieee.displayText: Warren Du Plessis, "Cross-eye gain in multiloop retrodirective cross-eye jamming", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 52, pp. 875-882, 2016, ISSN 0018-9251.

ieee.displayText: W. P. duPlessis, J. W. Odendaal, J. Joubert, "Experimental Simulation of Retrodirective Cross-Eye Jamming", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 47, pp. 734-740, 2011, ISSN 0018-9251.

ieee.title: Platform skin return and multiple-element linear retrodirective cross-eye jamming
ieee.displayText: Tianpeng Liu, Zhen Liu, Dongping Liao, Xizhang Wei, "Platform skin return and multiple-element linear retrodirective cross-eye jamming", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 52, pp. 821-835, 2016, ISSN 0018-9251.

ieee.displayText: Jianbin Zou, Kai Gao, Shujun Lu, Eryang Zhang, "Coherent decoys jamming anti-radiation missiles", Applied Electrical Engineering and Computing Technologies (AEECT) 2013 IEEE Jordan Conference on, pp. 1-5, 2013.

ieee.title: Phantom track generation using coherent dual moving sources for monopulse radar
ieee.displayText: Yangrui Zhang, Meiguo Gao, Yunjie Li, Siwen Cheng, "Phantom track generation using coherent dual moving sources for monopulse radar", Industrial Electronics and Applications (ICIEA) 2014 IEEE 9th Conference on, pp. 1451-1455, 2014.

ieee.displayText: Song-yang Liu, Chun-xi Dong, Jin Xu, Guo-qing Zhao, Ying-tong Zhu, "Analysis of Rotating Cross-Eye Jamming", Antennas and Wireless Propagation Letters IEEE, vol. 14, pp. 939-942, 2015, ISSN 1536-1225.

ieee.displayText: Tianpeng Liu, Dongping Liao, Xizhang Wei, Lei Li, "Performance analysis of multiple-element retrodirective cross-eye jamming based on linear array", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 51, pp. 1867-1876, 2015, ISSN 0018-9251.

patentCitations.patentAbstract: Method for generating and transmitting deception signals to location devices consisting of tracking monopulse radars and associated apparatus to be installed on aircraft in particular of the rotary-blade type. The deception signals generated and sent to the tracking radar cause an angular deception, namely the aircraft is viewed by the radar in a direction different from the real direction.
patentCitations.title: Method and apparatus for generating angular deception signals
